label: [NodeDev] Flow2UML
info:
::: aim

Create node that converts a Node-RED flow into a Mermaid flowchart diagram.

:::

::: requirements

- [nodedev](https://flows.nodered.org/node/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-nodedev) node package
- [development flow](https://flowhub.org/f/d0506e991d512ace)

:::

### Example

```mermaid
%% change this to LR Node-RED like UML
graph TB
239876c7e987f37e["LICENSE"] --> c5b74c4967a7bdab["README.md"]
b0f5aa186d1ea530["package.json"] --> 9787f001caee49e9["flowToMermaidJS"]
c5b74c4967a7bdab["README.md"] --> b0f5aa186d1ea530["package.json"]
3cce2f8bb1c495cb["Flow2Mermaid.js"] --> 12f20f599e71644d["usage example"]
4934281540e50042["Flow2Mermaid.html"] --> 3cce2f8bb1c495cb["Flow2Mermaid.js"]
12f20f599e71644d["usage example"] --> 4abc3509309ea1da{{"#91;nodedev-backend#93; entry point"}}
12f20f599e71644d["usage example"] --> 2bd8332b25178d44{"npmpublish"}
12f20f599e71644d["usage example"] --> 0db7ae2ee1688f85("debug 29")
f03b01497c16c75c["Install Package Locally"] --> 239876c7e987f37e["LICENSE"]
58ad9096a049bd57["prepare commit for cdn.openmindmap.org"] --> 966b2c12bc124684{"split"}
966b2c12bc124684{"split"} --> c83e498a1edbea4a["change"]
3e447b3d36b5192e["base64"] --> 3b67f307d90fe91d["create blob"]
c83e498a1edbea4a["change"] --> 3e447b3d36b5192e["base64"]
540423e89add682a{"join"} --> 9f79b5be7ff9aec0["blobs"]
d4c4a7848e8c9b04["change"] --> 540423e89add682a{"join"}
cf1b500165dd957a["blobs --> payload, message & author"] --> a7bfa733c7517756["create tree for blobs"]
9f79b5be7ff9aec0["blobs"] --> 2ad8e352b546097a["current repo revision #40;sha#41;"]
9cd21c2349d55ec5["parent_sha"] --> fe3b50aeda8be3a8["get tree for sha"]
53aa521f18c37c97["check sha of files"] --> |not same| cf1b500165dd957a["blobs --> payload, message & author"]
53aa521f18c37c97["check sha of files"] --> |same| 5ae0fa5ee67d5627["no changes"]
3b67f307d90fe91d["create blob"] --> d4c4a7848e8c9b04["change"]
2ad8e352b546097a["current repo revision #40;sha#41;"] --> 9cd21c2349d55ec5["parent_sha"]
fe3b50aeda8be3a8["get tree for sha"] --> daca002d8f6af328["get sha for embed folder"]
daca002d8f6af328["get sha for embed folder"] --> d2ca132b41328d51["get tree for sha"]
d2ca132b41328d51["get tree for sha"] --> 53aa521f18c37c97["check sha of files"]
a7bfa733c7517756["create tree for blobs"] --> f845ca7468b3b702["create commit"]
f845ca7468b3b702["create commit"] --> 0b868149f4fc589c["updating head on repo at branch - aka committing commit"]
0b868149f4fc589c["updating head on repo at branch - aka committing commit"] --> 811822bbb71d7dbf["changes committed"]
2bd8332b25178d44{"npmpublish"} --> |true| 58ad9096a049bd57["prepare commit for cdn.openmindmap.org"]
9787f001caee49e9["flowToMermaidJS"] --> 4934281540e50042["Flow2Mermaid.html"]
```


### Artifacts

- [GitHub repo](https://github.com/gorenje/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)
- [NPMjs node package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)
- [Node-RED node package](https://flows.nodered.org/node/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)

### Related flows

- [Testing flow for trying out ideas](https://flowhub.org/f/6e54d62e53ab5b6d)
- [Usage example](https://flowhub.org/f/666972381aaa960e)

name: Step 1: Install this flow for local development
flow that provides the basis for this node
Test the NodeFactory node to generate templates
Step 2: Install package locally into Node-RED
for each file, create blob at github
check that something did actually change

name: package.json
README.md
template:
## Flow to UML (Mermaid flowchart)

Convert the current flow tab to a Mermaid flowchart diagram.

**Warning**: will replace the contents the *info* panel of the node.

Also this is best used with Node-RED 3.1.x because that has inbuilt support for rendering [Mermaid](https://mermaid.js.org/) diagrams.

## Generating diagram

In the property panel, hit the generate button:

![img](https://cdn.openmindmap.org/content/1696066692869_Screen_Shot_2023-09-30_at_11.35.14.png)

Save the changes by clicking done and then there should be an image in the info box:

![img](https://cdn.openmindmap.org/content/1696066701424_Screen_Shot_2023-09-30_at_11.37.53.png)

## Discussion

This is a purely editor-based node with no interaction with the Node-RED server. The diagram generated is based on the current flow in the editor not the flow that has been deployed. Therefore any changes made in the editor will be reflected in the diagram generated.

## Mermaid Syntax

Beaware that Node-RED supports v9.4.3 of Mermaid and that the the [live editor](https://mermaid.live), at time of writing, at 10.4.0 - there are differences.

If there is a syntax error:

![img](https://cdn.openmindmap.org/content/1696066496021_Screen_Shot_2023-09-30_at_11.34.31.png)

Then you can edit the Mermaid code in the info tab:

![img](https://cdn.openmindmap.org/content/1696066696690_Screen_Shot_2023-09-30_at_11.35.57.png)

Save the changes and the info box will either show the image or not.

### Artifacts

- [Flow that maintains](https://flowhub.org/f/8e598f0f47194617) the codebase
- [GitHub repo](https://github.com/gorenje/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)
- [NPMjs node package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)
- [Node-RED node package](https://flows.nodered.org/node/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-flow2uml)

name: Generate Flow2Mermaid node
summary: Generate a Mermaid flowchart diagram from the current flow tab.
description: Generates a flow diagram using Mermaid and this flow. Node-RED 3.1.x how has support for Mermaid diagrams in the info boxes, so use that to display a diagram for the current flow.

name: Flow2Mermaid.js
Flow2Mermaid.html
usage example
